verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنِ ابْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلٍ شَهِدَ عَلَى شَهَادَةِ رَجُلٍ فَجَاءَ الرَّجُلُ فَقَالَ لَمْ أُشْهِدْهُ فَقَالَ تَجُوزُ شَهَادَةُ أَعْدَلِهِمَا وَ لَوْ كَانَ أَعْدَلُهُمَا وَاحِداً لَمْ تَجُزْ شَهَادَتُهُ عَدَالَةً فِيهِمَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus, from Ibn Sinan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding a man who testified upon a testimony of another man. So the man comes over, so he said to him, ‘I did not (appoint him) as a witness (on my behalf)’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The one who is more just from the two would be allowed (to give testimony), but if (there is only) one just (to be found), his testimony would not be allowed in fairness to both of them’.

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلٍ شَهِدَ عَلَى شَهَادَةِ رَجُلٍ فَجَاءَ الرَّجُلُ فَقَالَ لَمْ أُشْهِدْهُ فَقَالَ تَجُوزُ شَهَادَةُ أَعْدَلِهِمَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Al Washa, from Aban Bin Usman, from Abdul Rahman Bin Abu Abdullah, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding a man who testified upon the testimony of a man, so the man came over, so he said, ‘I did not (appoint) him as a witness’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The testimony of the more just of the two would be acceptable’.
